intro: Ervum humile, commonly known as the small cowpea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features trifoliate leaves and produces small, yellowish-white flowers that develop into pods containing edible seeds. Native to the Americas, it is often cultivated for its nutritious seeds and is adapted to a variety of soil types. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable plant in both agricultural and ecological contexts.
